sec.p: We used GenAlEx v6.5 [ 55] to perform frequency and distance-based analyses. Allelic frequencies were estimated following the method of Lynch and Milligan [ 56], assuming independent nuclear loci and Hardy–Weinberg equilibrium within populations. The expected Heterozygosity ( H E) was calculated as 2(p)(q) implemented for diploid binary data (dominant markers) and assuming random mating, where q = (1—Band Frequency)^0.5 and p = 1—q.

We converted genetic data into a pairwise individual-by-individual genetic distance matrix and used this to assess genetic structure within populations. This is a true Euclidean metric [see 55] as required for the subsequent analysis of molecular variance.
